name: Bluwan
text: Bluwan SA is the market leader in multi-gigabit multipoint wireless backhaul and access systems. Our solutions are used by service providers around the world to solve the bandwidth density challenge triggered by the ever-increasing demand for fixed and mobile broadband. Our LinkFusion and BroadFusion solutions, based on our millimetre wave Fibre Through The Air platform,  combat network saturation, capacity shortages and coverage gaps in areas where the business case for fibre deployments is unsustainable.

text:

The solution was integrated, approved & tested with market leading recording providers which have the largest presence in the Financial Services vertical worldwide.

text:

Brodit always puts its customers first. We work in close cooperation with our customers in developing unique custom made products fitting the end consumers’ needs. Since design and product development is in-house we do not have to compromise on product features.

name: brown-iposs GmbH
text:
brown-iposs is offering technical solutions for (radio) coverage in challenging environments.  Wireless links for Industry 4.0 and M2M in storages and production plants, the Integrated Radio Masts for Outdoor- and City-WiFi, optimization and planning of LTE, UMTS, GSM, WLAN, and microwave networks and services (Connected Crowd, bips.infotain) for arenas, fairs, leisure parks are provided.
Automatic drive test analysis, crowd sourced performance evaluation, mass data analysis, and load- and performance testing have been carried out in many projects since years. text:

Batteries are the key fundamental energy storage solution and considered as the most important part in any systems. BSB Power provides high quality products that are robust and reliable, which are produced following very strict quality assurance and control.

With five overseas subsidiaries and local partners, we strive everyday to provide the Best Solution of Battery all around the world.

name: Business Sweden
text: At the Swedish Pavilion, Hall 7E41–7F41, you can hear about the latest cutting edge mobile solutions coming out of Sweden now. More than 20 companies from the Swedish mobile and telecom industry will showcase innovative solutions within UI, mobile content and services, infrastructure, software design, device management, location based services, green technology and games. Demos will be available. The pavilion is organised by Business Sweden. Our staff is happy to introduce you to the companies represented in the pavilion and will help guide you to what Sweden has to offer. Follow us on Twitter for news and updates: Sweden_at_MWC

name: Business Wire
text:

Investor relations, public relations, public policy and marketing professionals rely on Business Wire to accurately distribute market-moving news and multimedia, host online newsrooms and IR websites, build content marketing platforms and provide audience analysis that improves engagement with specified target markets. Business Wire has more than 30 bureaus worldwide to securely meet the varying needs of communications professionals and news consumers.
To view exhibitor news visit www.tradeshownews.com .

name: Buzzinbees
text:
Buzzinbees provides equipment and software vendors with software that enables operators to make communication simple while making the most of their networks. Buzzinbees' SIM on-off node (Bee-SOON) flagship product provides networks with automatic SIM activation, improving operator service and bringing new revenue-generating opportunities such as user-selected numbers. 
Telecommunication operators and equipment providers worldwide have used Buzzinbees's carrier grade technology since 1988 with over 7,000 deployed platforms in nearly all telecommunication networks of the world.
More than three billion people rely on Buzzinbees's technology for telecommunications.

name: Bynet
text:

text:
Caleo Technologies is a successful software-solutions company offering a range of software and services related to Customer Care and Billing based on the company’s product Billiant. Caleo has an international customer base with customers in the Nordic countries, Switzerland, Spain and Egypt. Caleo offers Billiant as SaaS or a traditional license, in both cases with a pay-as-you-grow model.
Billiant is a service independent Billing & Customer Care system (B&CC) that allows service providers freedom in creating, managing and billing for any type of service, i.e. multi-play. Billiant is designed to be:
•	Feature rich & Future-proof
•	Adaptable & Affordable
•	Proven.

name: Cambridge Broadband Networks Limited (CBNL)
text:
Pioneering next generation microwave transmission equipment since 2000, Cambridge Broadband Networks (CBNL) is the global market leader in carrier-class, point-to-multipoint microwave backhaul and access solutions.

CBNL’s VectaStar platform is deployed by over 70 communications providers across 40 countries, including seven of the top ten mobile operators.

With high capacity and unparalleled efficiency, VectaStar improves network spectral efficiency by at least 40%, whilst offering total cost of ownership savings of up to 50% compared to alternative technologies.

In today’s data age, VectaStar is one of the world’s leading solutions for enterprise access, macro and small cell backhaul.

name: Cambridge Consultants
text: Cambridge Consultants leads the way in innovative product development. With one of the largest independent teams of wireless experts, we are the development partner of choice to many of the world’s leading blue chips as well as the virtual development team for ambitious start up companies. We develop breakthrough products, create and license intellectual property, and provide business consultancy in technology critical issues for clients worldwide. With a team of over 300 engineers, designers, scientists and consultants, we offer solutions across a range of industries. Cambridge Consultants is part of the Altran Group, the European leader in Innovation Consulting.

name: Cambridge Silicon Radio Ltd
text: CSR's Bluetooth, location, FM, Wi-Fi, audio, TV, video, and camera technologies are at the heart of many of the world's most recognised electronics brands. name: Canonical Group Ltd
text: Canonical is the company behind the Ubuntu operating system and the leading provider of support services for Ubuntu deployments in enterprise, OEM and telco sectors. Ubuntu is an open-source platform for client, server and cloud computing - including mobile devices and smartphones, as announced most recently. Since its launch in 2004, it has become a natural choice for users of all kinds, from Fortune 500 companies to hardware makers, content providers, software developers and individuals.

name: Capptain
text: Capptain is a mobile CRM company that empower marketers, app developers, product managers and business decision makers to track and analyze user behavior and demographics data in connected devices and to take marketing actions with push notifications and rich media in-messaging feature. Capptain technology can be integrated in apps for the major OS (Android, iOS, Windows Phone, Windows 8, WebOS), HTML 5 and SmartTV.

name: CardMobili
text:
A leading digital wallet solution provider, CardMobili’s end-to-end technology platform underpins a complete product portfolio – encompassing loyalty services, campaigns, communications, shopping and mobile payments.

Operating across Europe, Middle East, North Africa and Latin America, CardMobili’s expertise spans successful mobile loyalty and rewards schemes, and advanced mobile commerce deployments, working with mobile network operators, retail brands, merchants and financial services, in demanding situations.

 The emphasis is on fast market deployment, attractive merchant propositions, dynamic mobile services, and the proven foundation needed for a complete digital wallet strategy - unlocking new revenue streams, realising successful commercial strategies and enhancing the customer experience.

name: Carrier iQ
text:
Carrier iQ was founded to improve the quality and reliability of mobile networks and devices by delivering detailed customer experience diagnostics and analytics. Deployed on over 180M devices, Carrier iQ is the leading provider of Mobile Intelligence solutions using mobile devices to deliver insight into the mobile experience for network operators and device manufacturers.

Carrier iQ takes consumer privacy seriously. Anonymization and consumer choice are included Carrier iQ systems capabilities. Services are delivered to network operators via encrypted environments. Carrier iQ acts as a service provider to network operators and device manufacturers, making no independent use of the data collected.

name: Cavium, Inc.
text: Cavium is a leading provider of highly integrated semiconductor products that enable intelligent processing in networking, communications and the digital home. Cavium offers a broad portfolio of integrated, software compatible processors ranging in performance from 100 Mbps to 100 Gbps that enable secure, intelligent functionality in enterprise, data-center, broadband/consumer and access & service provider equipment. Cavium’s processors are supported by ecosystem partners that provide operating systems, tool support, reference designs and other services. Cavium’s principal offices are in San Jose, California with design team locations in California, Massachusetts, India, and China. For more information, please visit: http://www.cavium.com.

name: Cell Buddy
text:
Cell Buddy patented remote SIM technology empowers users to dynamically choose their mobile providers with a click. They keep their number and they can make and receive calls, including international calls, keeping Caller ID, messaging and data at a dramatically lower price and higher quality using marketplace app with a single SIM.

Cell Buddy enables carriers bypass the need to use rerouting for data roaming, bypass the need to sign roaming agreements and to execute integration. Small carriers can compete with big operators and get new local and roaming customers, meet new roaming regulations and empower their business.

name: Cellular Italia S.p.A. single shareholder company
CelPlan Technologies Inc
text:
CelPlan is a leading provider of RF Planning & Optimization Tools, Engineering Services, Consulting, and Certified Training. 
CelPlan's product line includes:
CellDesigner™- an advanced planning and optimization tool for all wireless technologies, oriented towards enhancing customer experience. It has enhanced 3D-RF predictions, multiple service classes, statistical SNR availability and customer experience considerations.
CellServices™- set of professional services available for vendors and operators, ranging from design, optimization, site surveys, drive tests, backhaul deployment, equipment installations, managed services and provision of specialized man-power.
CellSpectrum™- unique RF spectrum/technology drive test and analysis tool for 3G/4G, with focus on LTE.
CellTrace™- indoor/outdoor prediction tool based on ray tracing.

name: Centile Telecom Applications
text: Centile Telecom Applications is the leading European developer of unified communications platforms for operators and integrators. The Centile Any3 architecture – Any service, over Any network, on Any terminal – addresses the needs of businesses and operators seeking to deliver advanced professional communications services to fixed and mobile users independently of the device they’re using or the network they’re connected to. In the fast-moving market for fixed and mobile communications, Centile Istra solutions offer customers the flexibility and agility to rapidly develop innovative new services in response to changing customer requirements http://www.centile.com.

name: Centri Technology, Inc.
text: CENTRI is a leading provider of mobile bandwidth optimization and bandwidth management solutions that reduce network congestion and increase capacity across the network. With CENTRI’s Connected Experience Platform, including BitSmartCX and SmartStreamCX, mobile network operators can intelligently optimize and manage the flow of data across their networks in real-time to reduce the need to invest in additional network infrastructure and reduce backhaul costs. BitSmartCX uses an optimization technology that provides encryption and acceleration all in a single pass consistently reducing the traffic on an operator network. BitSmartCX’s optimization benefits are a perfect complement to help alleviate backhaul and transport dilemma.

text:

These systems are used to price and bill subscriptions and variable usage for wholesale, retail and white label services; B2B and B2C offerings and multi-country service provider portfolios.
Cerillion Skyline (www.cerillionskyline.com) combines this heritage of providing high performance billing and transaction processing engines in a public cloud architecture to provide a complete Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) billing application for the next generation of digital and non-digital services.

name: CEVA, INC
text: CEVA is the world’s leading licensor of silicon intellectual property (SIP) DSP cores and platform solutions for the mobile, portable and consumer electronics markets. CEVA’s IP portfolio includes comprehensive technologies for cellular baseband (2G / 3G / 4G), multimedia (vision, imaging, HD audio), voice processing, Bluetooth, Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) and Serial ATA (SATA). In 2013, CEVA's IP shipped in more than 1 billion devices, powering smartphones from many of the world’s leading OEMs, including HTC, Huawei, Lenovo, LG, Nokia, Motorola, Samsung, Sony, TCL and ZTE. Today, more than 40% of handsets shipped worldwide are powered by a CEVA DSP.

Comba’s product portfolio includes repeaters and boosters, antennas and subsystems, passive accessories, Wi-Fi and small cell systems and digital microwave links for 2G, 3G and 4G LTE systems. 

With over 50,000 deployments around the world such as full turnkey in-building wireless systems, urban/rural coverage, and transport networks, Comba’s end-to-end network solutions include consultation, network design, optimization and commissioning. 

Comba’s sales and support operations encompasses the globe with offices covering Asia Pacific, North and South America, Europe, Middle East and Africa.

name: CommScope
text:
Think Innovation. Think Simplicity. Think CommScope.

As a trusted resource and partner around the world, we’re invested in you: your people, your networks, your success. This inspires us to build relationships and develop infrastructure that connects people and technologies across protocols, oceans and time zones. We’ll never stop simplifying and evolving networks for the business of life at home, at work and on the go.

This is our promise to you.
This is CommScope.

name: Commsquare
text:

We master 12 years of engineering experience in radio and mobile data performance optimization and we monitor, investigate and optimize end-to-end mobile data networks globally.

To excel the quality of service of our customer’s mobile data networks, Commsquare developed and commercializes 2 world-class products:

DataMon is a passive probe solution capturing real-time control plane signaling and user plane data with an open interface to provisioning, revenue assurance, customer service, etc.

DAP is an active probe solution for permanent service monitoring, detailed investigation and benchmarking mobile data performance.

Comptel's service fulfillment, mediation, charging and policy control, and predictive social analytics products with implementation and professional services enable service providers to automate customer interactions and other business decisions, to create revenue, reduce costs and lessen churn. Forty-eight of the world’s top 50 mobile operators and nearly 3,000 developers rely on Dialogic to redefine the possible and exceed customer expectations.

name: Diametriq, LLC
text: Diametriq was launched in 2012 to focus on “Smart Signaling” solutions and meeting the ever increasing signaling traffic demands of 4G/LTE networks. The company was derived from key assets of IntelliNet Technologies, a wireless solutions company founded in 1992. Diametriq is built on IntelliNet’s Diameter technology and accomplishments. The company’s application enabled Diameter Routing Engine™ (DRE) addresses traffic management, interoperability and service migration issues. The DRE includes a Diameter Routing Agent (DRA), Diameter Edge Agent (DEA) and a Diameter Interworking Function (IWF). Diametriq also offers a cost effective edge device to facilitate LTE roaming, the Diameter Edge Appliance™.

name: Digibooks4all
text: Digibooks4all, is an international leader and technology innovator in the e-reading and e-bookstore platform market.  The company has developed a unique, white-label, cross-device s/w Platform, as an end-to-end infrastructure targeting Telcos aiming to extend their entertainment business (Value Added Service) they offer today to subscribers, in the eBooks & printed books market. The platform includes: Mobile apps for e-reading, e-commerce s/w, DRM for the eBook encryption and a large collection of eBooks from mainstream publishers. The solution is offered in a 'Software as a Service" model and on a Revenue sharing basis.

name: Digital Receiver Technology, Inc.
text: Wireless Test/Measurement equipment. DRT4311B Wideband Portable Test Receiver is unique with its software definable bands; a true SDR.  Network providers continue to use new LTE bands; the 4311B meets these and unanticipated requirements without purchasing additional units or having to physically change band filters. Band definitions can be implemented remotely.  A single 4311B is capable of supporting multiple air interfaces (GSM, UMTS, CDMA/EVDO, LTE-TDD/FDD, TD-SCDMA).  Its small size, light weight, and attachable battery make it ideal for indoor applications. Additionally, modular transmitters, tuners and processors can be configured for use by test equipment providers.

name: Digital Turbine
text:
Digital Turbine powers the global mobile market with inventive end-to-end products and solutions that integrate seamlessly across multiple operating systems and networks.
With 78 leading mobile operators in 28 countries as partners, and more being added every day, Digital Turbine provides greater flexibility and control at every stage of the mobile user experience— from better app management to smarter searches and easier shopping and buying in the mobile marketplace. The end result is a more dynamic and efficient experience in the hands of customers…all 1.5 billion of them worldwide.

text: DIOTEK is a professional company of mobile software solutions. And it provides TTS(Text to speech) and STT(speech to text) solutions as well. DIOTEK's products show the future of innovating mobile solutions. Booth staffs are ready for scheduled or instant meetings on site.

name: Discretix Technologies Ltd
text: Discretix is the leading provider of field-proven security and content protection solutions for Android devices. Discretix’ security IP, content and link protection solutions allow premium services to be securely deployed on today’s smart mobile and home entertainment devices. Licensed by the world’s largest smartphone, tablet, semiconductor and home device manufacturers, Discretix’ solutions are used in hundreds of millions of Android connected devices across the globe. Spanning from silicon to applications, Discretix security solutions are tightly integrated and deployed across all the leading hardware platforms.

name: Distimo
text: Distimo has a very clear objective: to make the app market transparent.  Today, Distimo provides the #1 free app analytics platform for developers, alongside the most accurate market intelligence for any app globally. Distimo’s passionate data team, world-class engineers, advanced algorithms and analytics platform make it possible for us to track over 280,000 apps worldwide and 3.2 billion downloads per quarter.

name: DonRiver, Inc.
text:
DonRiver provides management consulting and development services within the Telecommunication and Mobile Financial Services industries.  We’re relentless in providing results–driven solutions to our customers.

Within Telecom, we focus on providing consulting and development solutions within the network/OSS domain.  We help Telco’s implement their strategic vision by providing solutions in network inventory management, service fulfillment, service assurance and numerous other areas.

Within Mobile Financial Services, DonRiver provides consulting and development services to the world’s leading financial institutions.  Clients use DonRiver’s Mobile Financial Services Integration Platform to accelerate, make secure and reduce the cost of developing and launching mobile financial services.

text:
Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, dotMobi is an expert provider of mobile and web technology, helping companies reach their customers, no matter what the device, the content, or the context.
dotMobi provides a range of award-winning solutions to ensure content works in a dynamic web environment including the DeviceAtlas device intelligence solution, the goMobi mobile website publishing solution and the .MOBI top level domain.
dotMobi, a subsidiary of Afilias, was founded in 2005 by Ericsson, Google, GSM Association, Hutchison 3, Microsoft, Nokia, Orascom Telecom, Samsung Electronics, Syniverse, T-Mobile, Telefónica Móviles, Telecom Italia Mobile (TIM), Visa and Vodafone.

name: Dubai World Trade Center
text:
GITEX TECHNOLOGY WEEK
12-16 October 2014
www.gitex.com 

Let’s Create, Disrupt and Re-Imagine Together

GITEX attracts over 142,295 trade visitors from 150 countries to do business with more than 3,728 ICT companies from 61 countries. 80% of the world’s top technology brands actively participate in GITEX – these include: Microsoft, Dell, Intel, HP, Oracle, SAP, Google, f5, McAfee, Symantec, Ford, Kaspersky, Samsung and many more. text:

name: easyworks universe
text: Easyworks Universe is a design-based software development company.  Easyworks Universe won the Qualcomm Q-Prize in June 2012, and was called the "next LinkedIn" by organizers. Visumé provides a mobile space for creative talent to communicate and interact with one another.

name: EBlink
text: EBlink is the pioneer and leader of wireless fronthaul (wireless CPRI) technology with best in class spectral efficiency. Founded in 2005, EBlink based near Paris, France has an office in Silicon Valley, California. EBlink’s FrontLink™, products are targeted at a whole range of mobile architectures, offering unique solutions, supporting multi-sector and 3G/4G multi-mode, that allow operators to cost-effectively design, deploy and modernize their networks, reducing Total-Cost-of-Ownership. EBlink provides an elegant & risk-free evolution to the denser cellular networks required for continuously growing capacity needs through remote macro/small sectors cells.  EBlink products are validated and used by mobile operators worldwide.

name: Ebuzzing
text:
Ebuzzing are the global experts in online video advertising. Ebuzzing creates engaging, high impact video experiences, distributing video ads to audiences through placements within social media, and premium media properties.
To date, they have distributed thousands of campaigns for the world’s leading brands including Heineken, Acer, LG, Samsung, Evian and Adidas.
Founded by Bertrand Quesada and Pierre Chappaz in 2007, Ebuzzing now has 230 employees with offices across in New York, London, Miami and France, Italy, Germany, Spain, Luxembourg, Morocco and Dubai.  Its R&D department employs 50 people, demonstrating the company’s commitment to technology and  innovation.

name: Eden Rock Communications
text: Founded in 2007, Eden Rock Communications is a pioneer and industry leader in the Self Organizing Network (SON) space. Eden Rock uniquely addresses the emerging carrier demand for SON by bridging the gap between RAN and IT suppliers. Eden Rock has established a formidable IPR position with more than 20 issued and 70 pending SON-related patents. Eden Rock’s industry-leading SON solution, Eden-NET delivers the ultimate in network performance, reliability, and operational efficiencies. For more information, visit www.edenrockcomm.com.

text: Headquartered in Taiwan, Egis Technology Inc. In addition, Egis is taking part in the FIDO Ready™ Certification program to incorporate FIDO authentication standards into their products. name: Elitecore Technologies
text: Elitecore Technologies is a Carlyle Group investee global IT product company uniquely positioned to offer BSS, packet core and Wi-Fi Service Management Platform (SMP), providing flexibility of modular as well as pre-integrated offerings to achieve faster time-to-market with over 90 deployments worldwide. Elitecore is positioned in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Integrated Revenue & Customer Management – 2013. Its offerings are compatible in a multi-vendor environment to strengthen service provider need for faster roll-outs and better TCO. Elitecore products are highly responsive to next-generation services, fulfilling operator monetization needs across 3G, Wi-Fi and LTE while enhancing subscriber experience.

name: Elliptic Technologies
text: Elliptic Technologies is a leading provider of security for the connected world for chipset vendors, device manufacturers, service and content providers. Elliptic’s highly integrated solutions enable the most efficient silicon design and highest security levels for some of the world’s most popular products in markets such as mobile, networking, home entertainment, smart grid and automotive. Elliptic is leading the world in DRM and link protection solutions with flagship technology tVaultTM  for downloading and sharing premium content between multiple devices, including Microsoft® PlayReady®, DTCP-IP and  HDCP SDKs built for “trusted execution environments” used in consumer electronics. www.elliptictech.com

name: eRecyclingCorps
text: eRecyclingCorps (eRC) is a leading provider of mobile device trade-in and reuse solutions. Founded in 2009 to provide a scalable model to restore and reuse perceptually obsolete devices, eRC partners with global retailers to provide instant trade-in credit. eRC restores mobile devices in accordance with the R2/RIOS™ certification standards and is a founding member of the Device Renewal Forum. Devices are sold to consumers around the world, extending access to affordable, quality wireless technology. eRC has traded in more than 17 million phones and operates with leading carriers and distributors across a network of nearly 16,000 retail locations worldwide.

name: Ericsson AB
text:
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of communications technology and services. We are enabling the Networked Society with efficient real-time solutions that allow us all to study, work and live our lives more freely, in sustainable societies around the world.

Our offering comprises services, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology for telecom operators and other industries. Today 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic goes through Ericsson networks and we support customers’ networks servicing more than 2.5 billion subscriptions. 

We are more than 110,000 people working with customers in more than 180 countries. Ericsson is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.

name: eServGlobal
text:
eServGlobal has been a source of innovative solutions for mobile and financial service providers for 30 years, aligning with the requirements of more than 90 customers in over 65 countries.

We have supplied of Tetra networks worldwide, the product family is fully compatible and expandable from a single site, single base station Tetra system, up to a national multi site, multi base stations network.

text:
Ethernity Networks was founded in 2004, and since then developed and delivered high end network processing technology for Carrier Ethernet Switching, including Broadband Access, Mobile Backhaul, Carrier Ethernet demarcations, and data centers targeting $2.5 billion network processing SoC market. 
Ethernity Networks delivers innovative network processor SoC on FPGA/ ASIC, with hundreds of thousands of ENET devices deployed by global T-1/T-2 network operators. The ENET SoC offers  multi protocol interworking, traffic management, switching, routing, CFM/OAM , header compression and network processing, supporting up to 40Gbps on low cost FPGA that competes in price with off the shelf ASSPs.

Findings resulting from scientific research are directly incorporated into our innovation projects in order to sustainably increase the competitiveness of our clients and partners. name: eVolution-Networks Ltd.
text:

SES is also drastically reducing Operator carbon footprint.
SES seamlessly integrates into the network.
For the first time in the telecom industry, operators can accurately match energy consumption with actual Network needs, allowing them to consume energy in a smart, responsible and efficient manner and transforming their base station system into a highly efficient “Green Network”.

eWAVE offers Multi Service Optical Transport Network solutions which address any transport network application and offer various service and interface options. With our compact and high density platform, optical transport network is just simple and high reliable.

name: Expway
text: EXPWAY provides 3GPP compliant LTE Broadcast (i.e. eMBMS) middleware, and we also work directly with operators, to make sure that our software always also matches operators’ requirements. The middleware is LTE-modem agnostic, and it has been successfully Interoperability Tested with the world’s four leading Radio Network Vendors. Expway’s middleware has been extensively optimized for best performance, zapping time, startup time and CPU consumption for ARM processors. As a proof of the middleware's maturity as a product, the previous generation of Expway’s middleware has been deployed in over 10 million devices, on 30 different model smartphones and tablets.

name: Extricom
text:
Extricom is a worldwide leader in Wi-Fi solutions for high-density large venues – Sports and music arenas, stadiums, conference centers, transportation hubs and malls. Extricom's High Density Wi-Fi completely addresses the challenge of tens or hundreds of thousands of Wi-Fi clients in these crowded environments through leveraging the unique Channel Blanket concept combined with dedicated patented algorithms, augmented by a Wi-Fi offload solution.
Extricom provides excellent Wi-Fi coverage and capacity for high density large venues with a significantly smaller number of access points while enabling an eco-system of application partners for monetizing the Wi-Fi infrastructure.

text: GENBAND is a global leader in smart networking solutions for service providers and enterprises in more than 80 countries. From the Core to the Edge to the Experience™, the company’s technology seamlessly evolves IP networks to new levels in scalability, security, profitability and efficiency. GENBAND’s market-leading technology facilitates multimedia voice, data and video sessions and “anywhere” and “any device” services that scale on public and private networks. GENBAND is headquartered in Frisco, Texas, and has R&D, sales and support resources in more than 50 countries.

name: Genesis Technical Systems Ltd
text:
Genesis Technical Systems provides the ground-breaking DSL Rings® and mBond™ technologies, revolutionising copper for next generation broadband.

mBond™ provides unmatched value for fixed and mobile backhaul by enabling operators to re-use their existing copper backhaul infrastructure whilst increasing their copper backhaul bandwidth by at least a factor of ten. mBond is an extremely cost effective alternative to fibre and microwave, enabling telecommunications operators to realise far quicker and much improved returns on their investment. 

mBond meets the needs of the burgeoning small cell backhaul network that demands an affordable solution that can be deployed quickly, easily and in high volumes.

name: GEOIMAGE
text: GEOIMAGE was created over 25 years ago to specialize in cartography and mapping applications. Since then it has grown to become one of the largest digital mapping providers for the telecom market, with its own dedicated production facility in Tunisia. Over the past seven years, the company has created 750+ projects, and is happy to recognize many regular customers who trust its quality, service and products for wireless network planning.

name: Gigamon, Inc.
text: Gigamon® provides an intelligent Visibility Fabric™ architecture to enable the management of increasingly complex networks. Gigamon technology empowers infrastructure architects, managers and operators with pervasive visibility and control of traffic across both physical and virtual environments without affecting the performance or stability of the production network. Through patented technologies, centralized management and a portfolio of high availability and high-density fabric nodes, network traffic is intelligently delivered to management, monitoring and security systems. Gigamon solutions have been deployed globally across enterprise, data centers and service providers, including over half of the Fortune 100 and many government and federal agencies.

name: Gilat Satellite Networks Ltd.
text:
With 1 million+ VSATs delivered to satisfied customers worldwide, it’s no wonder Gilat Satellite Networks (GILT) leads in satellite communications. Tier 1-4 mobile operators use Gilat's solutions to rapidly deploy broadband services and to reach new, previously inaccessible markets. Offerings include: 
1. Satellite backhauling for GSM, UMTS, CDMA-2000 and LTE, reducing space capacity usage by up to 80%, compared to traditional solutions, optimized by sharing satellite bandwidth between cell sites and balancing jitter, delay (RTT) and voice/data compression. 
2. 3G small cell outdoor systems (small cell and gateway) for rural coverage, suburban sites and remote enterprises, fully 3GPP Release 9-compliant.

name: Ginger Software
text:
Ginger’s mission is to remove language barriers between people by enabling everyone to communicate in native-level English.

Ginger’s products reduce the stress associated with writing by ensuring grammatically perfect, typo-free text bursting with expression and meaning - exactly what you need to help you get your intended message across!

Our products are based on advanced language enhancement technology that uses statistical algorithms in conjunction with Natural Language Processing (NLP) to improve and enhance written communications.

Mobile Keyboard extends our technology into the mobile realm enabling sophisticated, typo-free communication while on the go!

name: Global Wireless Solutions Inc.
text: Global Wireless Solutions is the leading independent benchmarking solutions vendor for the wireless industry. GWS has also developed an app for Android devices for coverage and throughput tests.

name: GSMA
text:
The GSMA represents the interests of mobile operators worldwide. Spanning more than 220 countries, the GSMA unites nearly 800 of the world’s mobile operators with 250 companies in the broader mobile ecosystem, including handset and device makers, software companies, equipment providers and Internet companies, as well as organisations in industry sectors such as financial services, healthcare, media, transport and utilities. The GSMA also produces industry-leading events such as Mobile World Congress and Mobile Asia Expo.  
 
For more information, please visit the GSMA corporate website at www.gsma.com. Follow the GSMA on Twitter: @GSMA.

name: GSMA Marketplace
text:
The GSMA Marketplace is a new platform that enables buyers and sellers throughout the telecommunications industry to connect with each other for all types of telecom products and services.

For over 20 years, Mobile World Congress and other GSMA events have successfully connected the mobile and telecommunications industry to further the growth of mobile technology. By September 2014, GSMA will launch an online B2B Marketplace that allows you to connect effectively with new customers interested in your products and services.

Combined with core software solutions for imaging and authentication, the SmartFinger technology enables on-device enrollment, template storage and verification within the very same module. SmartFinger solutions can be seamlessly integrated into a variety of embedded applications such as mobile phones, tablets, laptops, peripherals, Smartcards, ID cards, payment terminals, access control, biometric security and login tokens.

name: Kumu Networks
text: Kumu Networks (www.kumunetworks.com) was formed by Stanford University professors and PhD graduates, and funded by NEA, Khosla, and Third Point Ventures. The team has succeeded to challenge some of the basic assumptions in wireless technology by building a full-duplex wireless system that can transmit and receive on the same frequency at the same time, doubling spectral efficiency! The solution is based on software-controlled self-interference-cancellation technology that eliminates the need for FDD or TDD duplexing. In addition to its potential for 5G standards, the technology can be used to improve spectrum reuse and remove limitations of hardware-based filters in existing systems.

Custom GNSS scenarios can also be created using dedicated SatGen software. In addition to GNSS signals, LabSat 3 can also capture and replay additional channels data such as CAN, RS232 or even inertial signals. Visit stand 7M15 for a demonstration.

text:

The company offers innovative solutions that address a wide range of markets including Telecom, HPC, enterprise, mega warehouse data centers, cloud computing, Internet, Web 2.0 and embedded. 

Founded in 1999, Mellanox Technologies is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California and Yokneam, Israel.

text:

With the MTS Air Interface Adapter (AIAD) and the MTS Shielding Box (MSB) it is possible to generate a mobile radio network in a laboratory environment. The AIAD is inserted into the coaxial links between real mobile phones and base stations; the mobiles or any other equipment are enclosed in a MTS Shielding Box. It is now possible to generate essential effects of different radio patterns, such as various handover situations, testing suits etc., without any interference from the live net.

www.mts-systemtechnik.de

name: Simgo
text:
Founded in 2012, Simgo, develops a cloud platform which allows remote, real time control over the identity (SIM) used by smartphones and other devices to register to the cellular network. Using Simgo, you can assign a SIM to a cellular device anywhere in the world, with a click of a button.
The 'virtual' SIM can be deployed either as a protective cover for cellular phones or integrated as a chip into any device with a cellular modem. Service is then attained via the Simgo operated global roaming network or a private installation with custom SIM assignment business logic.

name: Tarana Wireless
text:
Tarana’s universal wireless transport provides deterministic performance at full capacity across “True NLoS”, nLoS, and LoS operation delivering backhaul anywhere small cells are located.  It combines ubiquitous coverage, unprecedented capacity and scalability, zero-touch provisioning and operation, and the lowest total cost of ownership.
Tarana’s “True NLoS” is unparalleled, enabling wireless links completely obstructed by multiple solid structures to deliver the same high capacity as LoS without compromising range.  Its CMP topology supports concurrent links at full capacity in a single channel, delivering metro-scalability and spectral efficiency of 30bps/Hz (600Mbps across 8 links in 20MHz spectrum).
Please visit www.TaranaWireless.com

name: Western Union Digital
text: Western Union is a leader in global payment services, providing consumers and businesses with fast, reliable and convenient ways to send and receive money around the world.  Western Union services are offered through a combined network of more than 500,000 agent locations in 200 countries and territories, and approximately 100,000 ATMs.  Western Union Digital has 19 active mobile money transfer deployments in 17 countries worldwide, and transactional westernunion.com websites in 23 countries.  In 2012, Western Union completed 231 million consumer-to-consumer transactions worldwide, moving $79 billion of principal between consumers, and 432 million business payments.

name: Wi-Charge
text: Wi-Charge address the #1 pain of our lifestyle - the need to power and recharge CE devices. Leveraging proprietary Distributed Resonator(TM) wireless power transmission technology, we developed long range charging solutions that enable infinite CE devices usage time.

text:

name: Wirecard Technologies GmbH
text: Wirecard AG is one of the world’s leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for electronic payment transactions. The Wirecard Group has been supporting companies in accepting electronic payments from all sales channels. A global multi-channel platform bundles international payment acceptances and methods, supplemented by fraud prevention solutions. When it comes to issuing their own payment instruments in the form of cards or mobile payment solutions, Wirecard provides companies with an end-to-end infrastructure, including the requisite licenses for card and account products.

name: WiseSec
text:
Founded in 2011, WiseSec is a privately-held company, committed to redefining the future of mobility customer experiences. 
Based on its patent-pending technologies, WiseSec develops markets and deploys advanced micro-location solutions for security, payment, and retail industries, with special expertise in indoor micro-location, "NFC\RFID like" services, mobile security and mobility customer experience technologies. 
WiseSec's cutting edge, field proven solutions provide its customers with the most advanced, cost effective and secure mobility experiences available today.

name: Wolfson Microelectronics
text:
Wolfson Microelectronics plc is a global leader in the supply of high performance, mixed-signal semiconductor devices and audio solutions to the consumer electronics market. Wolfson’s innovative technology can be found at the heart of many of the world’s leading digital consumer goods, including premier hi-fi equipment, smartphones, mobile phones, tablet computers, MP3 players, televisions, digital still cameras and gaming. 

The company’s headquarters is located in Edinburgh, UK, with design centres, sales offices, applications teams and engineering expertise across Europe, the US, Australia and Asia.

name: Wray Castle Ltd
text:
Wray Castle has delivered telecoms training for over 50 years and is considered the foremost international training organization in telecoms. Training is developed by our industry leading experts and includes LTE; IP Networks and Protocols; Small Cell technologies; Transmission, Access and Signalling; UMTS and HSPA; GSM and GPRS; Radio Engineering and Professional Radio. 
Additional to our standard portfolio, Wray Castle develops bespoke courses, all of which are deliverable in a number of formats, including on-site; live online classroom; e-Learning; video; one-to-one and ‘brown bag’ sessions.  
We also provide consultancy and managed services.

name: Wuhan Gewei Electronic Technology Co., Ltd.
Wulff Entre Ltd
text:

Turn to us for turnkey solutions!

name: Xceed Technologies
text:
Xceed Technologies is a leading provider of software solutions for wireless network deployment, optimization, operation, and maintenance, SON as well as technology migration.  Xceed’s desktop and enterprise solutions are designed to streamline engineering processes to increase efficiency and productivity. Leading wireless operators, infrastructure manufacturers, engineering service companies and handset vendors use Xceed’s software products worldwide. Xceed’s products are installed at most major carriers worldwide and support all major wireless standards, including LTE, WiMAX, HSPA+, UMTS/GSM, CDMA/EVDO and iDEN.  For more information, please see www.Xceedcorp.com.
WindCatcher, Benchmarker, and Xynergy are Xceed’s Trademarks.

name: Yahoo!
text: Yahoo! is focused on making the world's daily habits inspiring and entertaining. By creating highly personalized experiences for our users, we keep people connected to what matters most to them, across devices and around the world. In turn, we create value for advertisers by connecting them with the audiences that build their businesses. Yahoo! is headquartered in Sunnyvale, Calif., and has offices located throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific (APAC) and the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) regions. For more information, visit the pressroom (pressroom.yahoo.net) or the company's blog (yahoo.tumblr.com).

name: Ybrant Mobile
text: Ybrant Mobile is a performance driven mobile ad network. a true global company with offices in 15 countries. Campaigns are run on managed direct media and we serve billions of impressions monthly. Ybrant Mobile runs both branding campaigns and performance ones and focuses on , CPC, dCPC, CPA, CPI models. text:

name: Zain
text:
Zain is a leading telecommunications operator across the Middle East and Africa providing mobile voice and data services to over 44.4 million active customers as of 30 June, 2013. With a commercial presence in 8 countries, Zain operates in: Kuwait, Bahrain, Iraq, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Sudan and South Sudan. In Lebanon, the Group manages ‘touch’ on behalf of the government. In Morocco, Zain has a 15.5% stake in ‘INWI’, through a joint venture. Zain is listed on the Kuwait Stock Exchange (stock ticker: ZAIN).

name: Zamir Telecom Ltd
text: Zamir Telecom Limited (www.zamirtelecom.com) is an established telco in the carrier market, providing innovative solutions backed by best-in-class customer support. We offer wholesale A-Z termination through our multiple direct interconnects with PTT / Tier 1 / Tier 2 and mobile operators. We also specialise in data services and IPLC, and have a proven track record in providing white-label managed services to other service providers. We enable smaller telecom providers the ability to use our switch partitioning facilities to minimise start-up costs. This includes enabling resellers / channel partners to offer multiple voice services using our infrastructure

name: Zighra
text: Zighra's KineticID provides effortless, automatic, and instantaneous user recognition by adding an invisible security layer to mobile authentication. KineticID plugs into existing mobile apps and implicitly recognizes a user based on their habits and interaction patterns, by actively evaluating the user’s unique kinetic interaction signature with their mobile device, such as the way the user holds their phone, the angle in which they hold it, the touch screen pressure, and acceleration among others. By avoiding mandatory explicit mechanisms such as PINS, passwords, and other biometrics most of the time – KineticID brings the ultimate in user convenience without compromising security.
